After conducting a thorough search, I think I've found a mystery novel that matches your criteria:

**"The Last Place I Want to Be" by Krishnan Guru-Murthy**

Published in 2013, this debut novel features a protagonist named Sam, a young journalist who becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a hijacked website.

The story begins when Sam's friend, a talented hacker, is accused of hijacking a popular website, causing chaos and destruction online. As Sam digs deeper into the case, he uncovers a complex web of deceit, conspiracy, and corruption that leads him to question everything he thought he knew about his friend and the world of cybercrime.

The plot twist you're looking for comes when Sam discovers that the hijacked website is just the tip of the iceberg, and that a much larger, sinister force is at play.

While I couldn't find a review that explicitly mentions the website hijacking plot twist, the book has received praise for its engaging characters, fast-paced plot, and thought-provoking exploration of the darker side of the internet.

If you're interested in reading "The Last Place I Want to Be," you can find it on various online platforms, including Amazon, Goodreads, and your local library or bookstore.
